grounding: The COVID-19 pandemic has arguably been one of the worst global catastrophes over the last several decades. A plethora of real-time research has been produced by the finance profession to try and understand the impact COVID-19 had on financial markets. In this issue, the Annual Review of Financial Economics provides five articles, all touching on different aspects of the COVID-19 crisis. This introductory article provides a brief review of these articles.
generated_text: This paper introduces a special theme on Financial Economics and COVID-19, exploring the pandemic's impact on financial markets, stability, and household behavior. It examines the integration of epidemiological models with financial analysis, highlighting the unique challenges posed by the crisis. The study investigates market reactions, policy responses, and shifts in consumer financial decisions, emphasizing the importance of understanding these dynamics for future crisis management and economic recovery.
